comments.body:
WDYT about this one? Is it worth or should I inline `.map(a => a must_=== other)`?
Is using same name `must_===` OK or confusing?
I think in the context of the library, it's great!
How about making `zio` a private val and the class extend `AnyVal`?

Actually `Value classes can have only one non-private val parameter`.
I would leave as it is. `zio` is currently private (no `val`) and both methods are available without any extra imports (like it would be in case of value class, because it cannot be placed inside class `BaseCrossPlatformSpec`).
Extra allocations shouldn't matter too much in tests.
This can be `R >: Environment`, which will include `Blocking` only for the JVM module.
I'll apply this in some subsequent work - I had problems with build recently.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@  val timer                    = new Timer()

  implicit def zioAsExecution[A: AsResult, R >: Clock with Console with System with Random, E]
    : AsExecution[ZIO[R, E, A]] =
    io => Execution.withEnvAsync(_ => runToFutureWithTimeout(io, DefaultTimeout))
